list_definition.definition: having, concerning etc industries or the making of goods

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That area of the country is industrial rather than agricultural.

list_ex_of_english: The numbers of industrials have continued to fall.
Of these 504,521 were non-industrials and 94,261 industrials.
A new volume of regulations for non-industrials is in preparation, which will make their position clear.
The negotiations, which are in their final stages, both as to industrials and non-industrials, have gone very smoothly.
Will my noble friend also say whether the trouble in the dockyards, the strike that they have been having among the non-industrials, is now settled?
Of the 100 additional civilians, 31 were already in their posts as industrials but had been reclassified as non-industrials.
Of those whose required retirement date is 60, we expect 770 non-industrials to be retired this year and 730 in 1982–93.
A number of specific amenity facilities for industrials and non-industrials working afloat and for naval staffs are also included in the development programmes.
